name: La Casa en Guanajuato

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The House in Guanajuato has two terrific advantages: location (a few steps to everything in the center of town, yet not overly loud), and Carlos the Innkeeper, who is an absolute delight. We stayed in the Don Quijote apartment, which was comfortable, although the bed was a double rather than a king as advertised, and the ventilation system means that noise is constantly coming down from the main house. When this is classical music, it's wonderful; however, when it's the sound of construction every single morning from 9am onward... The website is very much out of date, and the owners need to make clear to their paying guests that the house is not yet finished. On a related note, in the summertime at least, the house seems to be largely occupied by the owners and their family -- while you couldn't ask for a nicer family, this does create a different environment than the one suggested by the website, which gives the impression of self-contained suites, whereas this is much closer to a homestay (without meals). That being said, the atmosphere is very congenial, and the house is very convenient for everything in beautiful Guanajuato.
reviews.title: Lovely house, but closer to a homestay, and still under construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a newly remodeled hacienda in town and just a few blocks from the wonderful Plaza Jardin. Unlike many places in Guanajuato it is only up a short flight of steps from the street.
reviews.title: So comfortable

description: Spacious suites in an intimate setting. Centrally located, a few blocks to the Plaza de la Paz, Plaza San Fernando, and the Jardin. Colonial restoration with high ceilings and lush patios. Weekly stays encouraged. It's a great place to soak up the culture of colonial Mexico. Innkeeper speaks Spanish, English and French.
